questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.answer: A) air temperature increases with increasing height

mcq.option: A) air temperature increases with increasing height
B) air temperature decreases with increasing height
C) air temperature remains constant with increasing height
D) it is warmer at night than during the day

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.main: When the air temperature increases the saturation vapor pressure will:

mcq.option: D) vary over an increasingly broad range of values

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.main: Climate models predict that increasing levels of CO2 will cause the mean global surface air temperature to rise significantly by the year 2100. What other greenhouse gas must also increase in concentration in order for this condition to occur?

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.main: In the stratosphere the air temperature normally:

mcq.option: C) both increases and decreases depending on the season

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.main: As the air temperature increases the air's capacity for water vapor:

mcq.option: D) is unrelated to air temperature and can either increase or decrease

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.main: Without the atmospheric greenhouse effect the average surface temperature would be:

mcq.option: C) the same as it is now
D) much more variable than it is now

questions.main: Which below is not considered a greenhouse gas?

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.answer: A) enhance the atmospheric greenhouse effect

mcq.option: A) enhance the atmospheric greenhouse effect
B) weaken the atmospheric greenhouse effect
C) are often caused by the atmospheric greenhouse effect
D) have no effect on the atmospheric greenhouse effect

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_190909
questions.main: List the most abundant greenhouse gases in the earth's atmosphere. What makes them greenhouse gases?
questions.answer: Water vapor carbon dioxide methane nitrous oxide chlorofluorocarbons. They are greenhouse gases because they absorb a portion of the earth's outgoing infrared radiation and radiate it back to earth.
